intro: Dimorphandra parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered dimorphandra, is a deciduous tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant has a distinctive trunk with a rough, fissured bark that becomes more pronounced with age. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Dimorphandra parviflora plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
